website_summaries.verdict: Combines the cable modem and router into one package, which can improve the reliability of the connection, as well as cut down on space and wire clutter issues.
pros: Combination DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem and WiFi router
Router features 4 Ethernet ports, dual bands (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) and a firewall
Works with Charter Spectrum, Cox, and Comcast Xfinity and Xfinity X1
cons: Reports that the WiFi range is limited
Some Xfinity customers had problems getting this modem to work with their ISP

website_summaries.verdict: Motorola has gone above and beyond with this blazingly fast cable modem. If you need the fastest and most consistent internet connection available, this is the device you are looking for.
pros: Hands down, the ultimate high-speed cable modem made by Motorola
Perfect for streaming 4K content, video conferencing, online gaming, etc
cons: Not all internet providers support this elite modem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but beware of self-activation issues if you have an existing rented Xfinity modem.
customer_reviews.text: The device itself works perfectly. However, the self-install process with Xfinity failed. I have an existing Xfinity account with a rented modem. I was forced to call Xfinity to register the Motorola modem. First the tech had to deactivate the Xfinity modem. Then the new Motorola modem was activated via its MAC address. This process took about 30 minutes. After that, all is well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: All in One.
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Covers 2000 sq ft home and out door deck and patio. Former Motorola modem and TP-Link router were frequently dropping signal and the range appeared to be diminishing. Strong signal with this hardware and it has not dropped connection once yet. Internet speeds appear faster. Like the option of having both 5 and 2.4 networks available.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Musburger

customer_reviews.title: Major Firmware and internal issues
customer_reviews.text: After one month the router had issues with dropping signals and cycling. Was able to be fixed once by comcast tech support, problem reoccurred one day later and is now unfixable by them. Since it is after the 30 day return policy, amazon wont accept a return or replacement so I was forced to send it to the Manufacturer for a replacement which took 2 weeks and I was forced to pay shipping. Not worth the plastic it is made out of. Avoid this router/modem at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: MCCONRA

customer_reviews.title: Motorola MG7100, DOCIS 2.0 or 3.0?
customer_reviews.text: Amazon advertises this item as a DOSIS 3.0. The sealed box indicated the item was a DOSIS 2.0. One review that I read indicated that Motorola said the 2.0 was just to indicate how better the 3.0 is. But, there is no comparison around the 2.0. The corner of the package indicates that the enclosed modem is A DOSIS 2.0. So, what do I have? No way to prove it's a 2.0 or a 3.0 that I know of. Bought this as a replacement for the Motorola R6100. Easy installation, no indication that its faster.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: Fast! Online activation for Spectrum was not possible
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over my previous modem/router! Now I can actually enjoy the internet speed promised by my provider, especially for wifi. One issue though, although it is indicated that this modem is supported by Spectrum, I was not able to activate it myself online, I had the error message that this model was not authorized on Spectrum Network. After calling Spectrum support and talking to 2 different services, the problem was solved in 20 min.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It's garbage.  Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: All it does it drop my connection every day, multiple times. I figured I would be ending up in the plus for not renting a combo modem/router from my ISP, but this is intolerable and I can't even log into it's web app. For $180 I certainly expected better. A huge thumbs down, the unit Comcast gave me that I replaced with this was a lot less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: CB77

customer_reviews.title: Bad modem/router
customer_reviews.text: We were considering buying the nighthawk modem/router but bought this instead because it had better reviews. My husband installed it but it wasn’t working well and Comcast said it was “offline”. A tech came out and ran his tests. He basically told us the WiFi didn’t work and we got a bad router. Since then we got the nighthawk and have had no issues and great connection!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Range Sucks.  Returning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a failing Netgear router and wanted to have a two in one, modem + router instead of two separate pieces like I previously had. Major fail on my part. I've even called the Motorola helpline to ask about settings improvements, all to no avail. I can connect to the internet/wifi, but the speed is basically dial-up at best. I can no longer stream from Netflix/Hulu and game apps on my phone are laggy and failing. I'm now looking for a replacement to this one and it's getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Not supported by Spectrum as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The item description states: "Approved by Comcast Xfinity, Cox, Charter Spectrum". That is why I bought it. But after installing it, and at the point of register it with spectrum, the web page shows an error saying: "Router not supported". I then contacted Spectrum support, they told me the router is not in their list or approved routers.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Soto Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great modem/router
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. We needed both a modem and router and this 2-in-one was a great value for the money. It set up quickly and easily and we're watching Hulu Live on 2 TVs, using phones, Kindles, 2 printers and 3 Alexa's without any issues. It is placed in a corner room on the first floor and we have no issues anywhere in the house. I got this to work with Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Fagan

customer_reviews.title: Speeds aren't as advertised - Max 140Mbps over Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple, I could only get download speeds of 140 Mbps over wifi. I have an Xfinity internet plan that's capable of 400 Mbps and had to have a technician come to troubleshoot why my speeds weren't getting anywhere near 400 Mbps. It came down to the device itself not being able to handle the speeds. I'm very disappointed they advertise this device like it can handle speeds of 656-1000 Mbps. It's very misleading, so don't bother if you're looking for fast wifi speeds. Perhaps my device was faulty, but this is my experience.
customer_reviews.author: James Camut

customer_reviews.title: Drops Connection
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this modem a 5 star review but now I'm downgrading it to 1 star because it only last ~2 months before it started dropping connections; my internet is unusable because it drops every 15-30 minutes. And the 5G connection is weak. I'm only one room over and the Wi-Fi only gets 2 bars on my devices. But the 2G connection has full bars. Why is the the 5G not working but the 2G is? For $200 I don't expect this kind of garbage. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunie

customer_reviews.title: Started off good, now it’s bad, then terrible
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, internet works well overall. Every now and then I notice some buffering and this seems to be a little more than the Comcast rented modem.....but I like saving the rental fee! Update: I constantly have to reset my modem in order to get the internet working. It’s getting frustrating. After 3 months I realized it’s the modem that was the problem. Every morning Hulu wouldn’t work and I had to reset the modem. I’ve switched back to renting a modem for now and I’ve had no issues. Very disappointing. It was working fine and after 1-2 months it starts acting up. Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Brad N

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace both a modem and router because of several glitches over the past few months. Easy installation, like having choice of 2.4 or 5 channel, and very fast. I am not a techie so the simplicity of having one unit doing the job of two was appealing. Have only had it installed for a week, but very happy with the choice. I had used reviews from several on line independent sources before deciding on this particular unit for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Razz Berry

customer_reviews.title: If within your budget, buy it
customer_reviews.text: My DOCIS 3.0 modem died and I ordered this to replace it. Next day delivery! On the expensive side but decided it was worth it for the 8 X 24 channel configuration. On my 100MBPS service it runs 4X24 and the unit is extremely stable. Cured my problem with intermittent unit. Having 4-RJ45 ports means I don't need a separate router. I use two and have two spares for future. Hardest part was the time 30 minutes - for Spectrum to activate the unit. The tech would enter my MAC address and it would be rejected. Had to get a supervisor to add this model to their database. Simply a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. instructions couldnt be any easier. runs perfect. Xfinity speed test shows around 15-20 mgb faster download and around 5mgb faster uplad. Nothing to complaint about. I have it for only a week.. using for netflex .. wwe network and all social media. so far so good.. I called Comcast to remove one that i was paying for ,comcast rep. was looking at this modem spec. and he was impresed.
customer_reviews.author: mariusz lipinski

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a pile of crap for the money you pay. I have had it for a week or so and I have to restart the thing 10 times a day because it constantly hangs and disconnects. I have been through available online data to change settings etc to no avail. Extremely disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Wired connections had massive packet loss from installation, and device just stopped working completely in 4 months. Was not impressed by wireless range, and speeds, as well. If you do not game or stream, this is a good basic modem/router. Apparently unable to get a refund, so I switched to Netgear Nighthawk with significantly better results.
customer_reviews.author: NIck

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I would equate this modem router combo to a piece of street trash. It was giving me problems from the moment I installed it. It would drop connection several times a day and need to be reset. I thought it was a problem with my ISP, but after fighting with them for several months regarding the signal and having four tech. visits, it turns out it was the modem from the get go. ABSOLUTELY would not recommend this modem. Nothing but problems. I would have expected better from Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Louis J. Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Comcast Cable Modem Rental replacement
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem to replace my Xfinity/Comcast cable modem rental. Removed the rental and plugged the Motorola into electrical and connected via Ethernet to my computer. Brought up Internet Explorer and connected to xfinity.com. Took a little bit of time but it finally allowed me to login via the “Lets get Started” page. Logged into my Comcast account at that point and I was good to go. Overall the process was not too bad. Just wanted to share my experience. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: GORT

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Modem worked well for less than a year, but stopped working. I had to continuously reset it to get it to work. ISP sent out techs two times to look at the signal with no improvement. Hours wasted on the phone with tech support. I tried resetting it to factory settings, nothing worked. Eventually I had Cox install their own modem and it works consistently with no issues for the past week. For what I paid this equipment should have lasted much longer with no problems. The point was to have something better than my providers equipment without paying rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: dawgs01

customer_reviews.title: Simple Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Router due to the reviews and all in one nature. Pros: Easy to set up Powerful range Good Throughput Cons: If you deviate from the Out-of-box Configuration, things can get wonky. Simple thing like Changing IP Scheme or DHCP range would cause random intermittent connectivity issues. I tried to apply DDNS, same thing happened. All in all its a good router out of the box. But if you are someone that runs a custom network, I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over what I had.
customer_reviews.text: I have Comcast 150mbs but realized my old modem/router setup capped out at "100mbs"... which was more like 20mbs when I ran speed tests. This modem was REALLY simple to set up and the increase in speed was noticeable INSTANTLY. Speed tests are coming back right around 150mbs throughout most of my 2500 sq ft house... and measuring at over 50mbs in the farthest areas away from the modem, including my back yard! I love knowing it can handle much higher speeds if I choose to increase in the future too.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Dusconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Had it 4 days constant disconnect issues. Only getting about 125 of my 150 mpbs. I didn't have to time to call xfinity to see if it was running optimal but who's got time. This should blaze right out of the gates. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: be warned
customer_reviews.text: This may be a great product. That said...WARNING!!!!!!! We have Comcast. Called about a month ago to try to save on our bill and Roku was suggested. Also said we could purchase our own modem/Router. We did this. Called today and Comcast tells us now you can not stream on Roku with your own modem. We talked to probably 6 people from Comcast and until no one mentioned that you will NOT be able to stream Roku unless you use their modem for security reasons! After all this it would have been nice to be told that in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: According to the technician at Comcast, it is top of the line. it is very easy to install and to personalize, meaning changing the network name and the password. All the instructions come enclosed in a booklet/ pamphlet. There is no need to call Motorola or instructions. Comcast just adds the device to the system and instructs how remove the previous one to install this one. The rest is all well described in the pamphlet enclosed. I'm very happy! It was absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gambe

customer_reviews.title: Unit is good- support is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a second one the first one did not work. After spending many days with Comcast and two technicians, we finally figured out it was the modem/router and not Comcast for once. It took 45 minutes for tech support at Motorola, so if you don't have that time just send it right back. In 5 minutes Motorola figured it was a bad unit and told me to call Amazon and return it. The new one works like a charm. I can now give a 5 for the new unit but a 1 for tech support.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA SORENSEN

customer_reviews.title: Wifi range disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in the range of the wifi system in our single level 2300 sq ft home. I tried using an Orbi mesh system but it requires turning off the motorola router which by default will turn on again every time there is a interruption in the power. I returned the Orbi and installed a Netgear 750 wifi extender which does boost our signal but not anywhere close to the Orbi mesh system. If you have a large home I recommend purchasing a modem separately from the router. Than connect a mesh router such as the Netgear Orbi system and you should have a great system for most homes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Supancich

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Nintendo Switch online gaming issue with Xfinity broadband
customer_reviews.text: Prior to installation of this cable modem I was having issues with online gaming with my Nintendo Switch. The scenario was that with my old router, the Switch online test was giving me an "F" rating and that meant Mario Cart online gaming wasn't working. What seemed to have happened was Xfinity had increased my download speed and my old TP Link cable modem wasn't up to the job of handling the higher speeds. This resulted in Switch online gaming breaking. Having installed this newer, much more capable cable modem the problem went away. So if you're having a similar issue I woild recommend giving the MG7700 a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi signal and died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm a techie, the modem/router simplified my troubleshooting process and I liked that. The wifi range was inferior to a 5year old Asus N900. However that wast why it's getting one star. 3 months after purchase the router stopped working. We believe it's the power supply converter but are unsure. With as annoying as it is to swap out modems... This is very frustrating. Amazon's return period expired two months ago so I will now need to see what motorola can do but this really is an unacceptable failure.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan N. Elleby

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem and WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Just received this modem, and had it setup and activated in less than 20 minutes! Seems to work great. I'm on Comcast, out in the boonies, and just got a speed test of 72.39 download, and 6 upload. Write the password down that's on the bottom sticker, you'll need it to log anything onto the Wi-Fi. I always forget, and wind up having to try to turn the thing upside down all the wires still connected, and try read the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: cootertwo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with issues of a 3-year old modem/router from a different manufacturer, I made the decision to come back to Motorola. The device was simple to setup and contains instructions if you need them. Ensure to contact your ISP with the MAC address of your new device. The Motorola software for the device has many features including the ability to allow only certain devices on your WiFi network, change your network name, network password, etc. Network speeds over LAN were right at what my ISP provides and WiFi speeds were just as good too. Time will tell if this was a good buy but things are looking good so far.
customer_reviews.author: 101Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play on Comcast, excellent range
customer_reviews.text: Easy peasy if you have a PC/laptop. Use provided ethernet cable to hardwire laptop to modem during installation. Comast sent code to my cell for authentication during installation. Remember to check laptop security software prior to installation. Signal strength and range from this device is excellent. Solved my old cell phone's poor WiFi reception issue in my multi-room old house (had been using Netgear C3700). Random character string password is a PITA but a small price to pay for much improved service (not to mention zero modem rental fee).
customer_reviews.author: ACAR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, and love the 5GHZ Wifi
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Xfinity-rented box with this great device. It was very easy to install and setup, and works fine. The cable company's box had only 2.4 GHZ wifi, but the Motorola also does 5GHZ. The average wired connection to my PC clocks at 110-120 Mbps/s, which has not changed with the new box (I didn't expect it to) but with my phone and tablet switched to 5GHZ Wifi, wireless connections went from the high 20's/Mbps on 2.4GHZ to the high 60's/Mbps, a substantial difference. The monthly modem rental fee was up to $14 lately, so the expense is a no-brainer; I should have done it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Estimed_customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints so far
customer_reviews.text: Getting close to the 600 mbps that Xfinity promised. That's on my desktop and connected via ethernet cable. The wifi is about 1/6 of that (100 mbps on the 5GHz frequency). Still more than enough speed to stream HD video on multiple devices simultaneously. Was on the phone for about 10 minutes with Xfinity. They disabled their router and activated mine. I was on hold longer than the process actually took. Overall pretty painless. Just returned the Xfinity router, so I'll be glad to see the $14 monthly lease fee gone on my next bill.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Fields

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.text: I finally bit the bullet and bought my own modem to replace the one being rented from Comcast. The catalyst was I started having to reboot the Comcast modem 4 to 5 times a week because the wifi connection would randomly drop. Devices were still connected to the network but no internet. Comcast's solution? "Have you tried rebooting the modem?" :O This modem was easy to set up (I have some networking knowledge for full disclosure but still). Performance has been very good since installed. I gave Tech Support only 3 stars because, well, I didn't need any so really a neutral there. Tip: Do NOT leave the default password unchanged!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry R.

customer_reviews.title: Great, fast, saved me $$ instantly.
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up yesterday (02.20.20) and so far so good. Set up was quick and easy, I just called comcast, gave em the MAC & SN # and boom up and running. The wifi works great and I seem to get decent signal in my small(ish) home. Only issue so far, was when we tried to shareplay on the PS4 (which is hardlined from the modem) I kept receiving a NAT type failure, if you have this issue just adjust your router settings to enable PlugNPlay and BAM problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Parker T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great user ratings, 5 star modem.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the highest user ratings of any modem in it's class. That is what prompted me to upgrade to this model. Even the cable rep that helped activate it remarked, "that's a very good modem." Setup was easy, self activation did not work on the Cox website, but a quick call had it up and running. Very pleased, and it has made a huge difference in performance. WI Fi range is very good.
customer_reviews.author: racar45

customer_reviews.title: Works well, noticed speed difference from cable companies old modem.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, I just change the router passwords and WIFI passwords to the same names and passwords as my old router/modem so nobody that comes to visit had to change the connection for my wifi, including me, plus I didn't have to change my other device's passwords/wifi info. I don't gaming or anything but my online hd video loads much faster and never freezes or buffers, even when I am using multiple devices. I am not sure if the wifi distance is as strong, or if it's just my old cell phone causing the issue when I'm outside. Inside everything works well.
customer_reviews.author: Vulkrider

customer_reviews.title: Terrible range. It is not compatible with Xfinitys 1000 MBs
customer_reviews.text: This modem & wifi router claims to work with Xfinity’s one gigabyte download speed, it does not. The best it would go is up to 600. And Xfinity would not send the 1000 MBs because the modem cannot handle it. And the range is terrible, we cannot get Internet in the next room. The advertising on this product is lying because it says that it is compatible with Xfinitys 1000 MBs but if you look on Xfinity‘s check my device website it is incompatible. We’re sending it back for what we hope will be a better modem Wi-Fi router That is on Xfinity’s check my device website listed as compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Speedy
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I was needing for my speed and range issues. I’ve had a Motorola modem/router for ten years and after five cross country moves and age, it wasn’t keeping up with our internet speeds and range. With this product, my entire house and backyard get high speed Internet, nothing like before. I tested our speed with the old and max was 25mbps and with the new it is 253mpbs. Amazing now no waiting to load, and my entire family and guests can be doing their thing and no one is slow!
customer_reviews.author: SRami

customer_reviews.title: Drops signal every 5 minutes. NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Install with Comcast service was fast and easy. That being said, this device drops your connection every 5 minutes, on hard-wired AND WiFi connections. They tried to say it was my ISP. I was very unhappy after a couple weeks of that, and returned it. Not recommended. Replaced with Netgear Nighthawk - no more dropped connections and endless buffering. Problem WAS the modem - not the ISP.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Possible Defective Model... Straight from Motorola Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: I connected the first one Tuesday. 5G didn't come up on the wifi list (yes, light was on as if it was active). called Motorola. tech advised i call amazon and have a new one shipped. tried the second one on Thursday and same issue. called Motorola. Tech advised to return it and buy something from a different brand. that was his recommendation. now, this is coming directly from the Motorola tech, to buy from a different brand. clearly Motorola isn't so great nor are the workers so loyal to the brand. definitely purchasing a different brand. This particular model "must have issues" i was told.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A.

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure how I feel about this router.
customer_reviews.text: It can handle the higher data speeds.. but it appears to lack strong enough single wifi power to reach all rooms in a 2 story row home... Couldn't imagine the signal if it was a 3bedroom flat..
customer_reviews.author: Mercy

customer_reviews.title: Good modern, but no app to monitor wifi...
customer_reviews.text: Like: easy setup. Dislike: non-compatability with Xfinity apps. There is no way to monitor usage without going to third-party apps which are woefully unreliable. Unsure: Xfinity got mad at me for dropping the modem I rented from them. My signal is good but on occasion it suddenly glitches. Not sure if this it their doing but never had this issue before.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work Out
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this router/modem to work, because a had a Motorola before that worked really great. But I wasn't getting the internet speed I was entitled too. And my speed changed erratically from super fast to super slow. I worked with xfinity to try and resolve it, but finally switched to a Netgear. I instantly had 298 mbps and have pretty much stayed in the mid to high 200s. It's possible the Motorola was defective, because they have a good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: RichCD

customer_reviews.title: Sent a pre owned one not a new one.
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty sure I paid for a new one, however they sent me a used one. The giveaway to this being pre-owned was a) the Ethernet cable was missing and b) the default password to access the modem had been changed and I had to reset the modem to get it to work. Once I did, it works fine. Tried to contact company and Amazon. Got no where. Amazon help unfortunately was based offshore and I could not communicate effectively what the problem was for her to understand me. No help so apparently it's ok to rip off people with used for new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working fine with my Xfinity internet. Not seeing much of a difference as far as performance, but I’m sure it’s Comcast and not the router. I run 5 tv’s, two laptops, and 5 cell phones with no connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Best Money I spent
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get it configured in about 15 minutes. Now calling my service provider, Sparklight / aka. Cableone, and getting it connected to my account took a few. However, it works perfectly for me and I am seeing at times better speeds than what I am paying for. I had been using for the past 6+ years Motorola SURFboard SBG6782-AC that was starting to loose connection randomly and my WiFi speeds were coming in at 50% slower. I am extremely happy with this WiFi modem router combo and strongly recommend it to anyone else looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: AdamAnt

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Just received this unit today to replace my 6-yr old rented Comcast/Xfinity unit which has been malfunctioning for the past several months (we think). Set up and activation was a breeze and took all of about 20 min (15 of which was waiting for connection; standard stuff). Testing the malfunctioning modem theory by subjecting this new one to the same conditions which ordinarily would send the other one on the fritz. So far, I swear the picture quality on TV seems to be better somehow. Maybe it’s purely psychological... We’ll see :-)
customer_reviews.author: sweetapus

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of give the cable company $15 every month for a modem I have paid for 4x over in the last 4 years! Ridiculous! Read the spec and bought this and it works great. It is actually a bit faster than my cable modem was. Hook up was easy, just plugged it up, pulled up cable company site and added credentials. Did not need any tech help. Waited a week to make sure it was performing, then turned in my cable modem, bye-bye monthly fee! Would caution to research for the right modem for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in March 2020, already having to replace it August 2020. I work in IT and did all of the troubleshooting steps and still got incredibly slow speeds. Replaced it with a modem from my provider (WoW internet), and get the speed that I pay for. No way I'd buy this piece of junk again
customer_reviews.author: Ragan Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Motorola Cable Modem/Router combo unit - I had good luck with the first one at a different location, so I bought one for my main condo of about 1100 sq ft with about 10 devices running off either of the dual bands and no issues whatsoever. The setup and provisioning with my cable operator was good - all done without a phone call. I think it's worth the $$$ and I needed up do an upgrade on my device as my old 'gateway' was obsolete based on the speed improvements my cable operator has made.
customer_reviews.author: M. Castle

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product five months ago. Since last week the modem keeps rebooting every 15-30 minutes. I tried to call the Motorola customer service for modems multiple times. I was put on hold for almost 2 hours and when it was my turn they just disconnected me!! This happened twice. I wrote to their customer service email, but no reply for three days. Now the unit does not even broadcast the wifi signals. I would advise anyone against buying any Motorola product let alone this product. I would have given a negative rating if it were possible.
customer_reviews.author: Sumaiya Nazeen

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't work
customer_reviews.text: After loosing the first shipment, amazon immediately shipped another. Set up was easy, but the WIFI wouldn't connect to all items. After 9 hours of effort, 3 calls to Motorola, and 2 to Comcast, Motorola decided that the unit was defective. Their tech support was great. Even Comcast was great. So I give 1 star to the unit, but 5 stars to the folks that tried to help me out.
customer_reviews.author: cad

customer_reviews.title: Get nest router with point instead
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up on Wi-Fi and good instructions. Wi-Fi signal was not as good as expected on my 2300 square foot ranch. I have many devices (nest cameras, thermostats etc). The 2ghz channel was running about 6-9 mbps and the 5ghz channel was 130 mbps next to the router and about 30 mbps in my office. My wireless cable box in the bedroom wasn't getting enough signal to work properly. Don't normally write reviews, but was not pleased with this given the cost. The xfinity box with 2 xFi pods worked better in my opinion. I got the nest router with one point and it is a night and day difference. I am getting around 200-120mbs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor range
customer_reviews.text: When I switched to this Motorola router, the speed of my laptop connection was poor and spotty. After struggling for several months, I finally moved the router so that it is 16 feet from my laptop. Now the signal is adequate. It's very disappointing that this router does not have more signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Muller

customer_reviews.title: Decent router, Ugly UI
customer_reviews.text: All of the tools are there but the UI is probably the ugliest UI I've ever used. They purposely put things in odd places to make it an "easy to use" router that still delivers a certain level of robustness....lame. If someone is ordering their own modem\router on Amazon, they most likely know how to configure it and don't need\want their hand held. Everyone else is just going to use their ISP's router. DUH. Come on Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Reset at least daily to keep internet.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace rented modem and old router. Install was easy, had to activate over the phone with Xfinity. Speed and range was very good however we kept losing internet and would have to reset modem. Returned due to frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Legris

customer_reviews.title: Much faster.  Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Comcast Xfinity router/modem speed test on the left, my new Motorola MG7700 speed test on the right, 4 times faster. Amazing! Very happy with the improved speed. Should have bought my own modem years ago. Now if only xfinity would provide the speed we are paying for...I
customer_reviews.author: WeHa Food Critic

customer_reviews.title: Wow- EDIT- after one year it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the difference this made in my internet speed. I am paying for 75mgb and could only top out at 45-50 at the most. I put this on, I am consistently at 70-72. I can't believe the difference it made in speed. Worth the money for sure. EDIT: After a year it now drops the connection about every five mins. I've had the cable company to my house-the problem is the mode. Taking my review to 2 stars because I don't want to have to spend $200 every year.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Awful tech support, hit or miss WiFi speeds
customer_reviews.text: The router is a little spotty but does the job. Motorola's tech support is however, the worst I have ever seen. The agent knew less than I did about our technical issues and how to resolve them, made no attempt to try and was quite rude on top of it. Never going to make the mistake of buying a Motorola product again. Steer clear if you have the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: 2nd bad motorola modem
customer_reviews.text: Motorola modems are trash. Hooked this one up and it worked with decent speeds and then died after 10 minutes. I also ordered a N450 modem in 2018 and that never worked right. Save yourself some time and frustration DON'T BUY MOTOROLA. Customer support did nothing to help but blame my ISP in 2018. then I got stuck with the trash due to it passing 30 days for returns. Amazon customer support however helped tremendously
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Comcast rental replacement
customer_reviews.text: Went from Comcast Voice modem, Dropped the home phone and the 13.00 a month rental fee. to this. Of course Comcast doesn't want you to downgrade so they make it pretty painful for you disconnect and re connect if you are trying to save money. But we persevered and in the end this modem seems faster and better than the rented one. A total money saving success...
customer_reviews.author: Stbentoak

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this one
customer_reviews.text: I helped a friend convert to cable internet. While setting up the appointment for installation the tech commented it was a good choice. After installation the speed was excellent and the wi-fi works great. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: E. F. Kraski

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast easy to set up with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our equipment last week. we were paying for more internet than our old modem could produce. Since we upgraded to this our speeds have doubled! we have Xfinity internet and highly recommend it. We were able to get it hooked up and online all thought their website/app, using our cellular connection. our previous modem only put out up to 130 speed, we are now seeing 260-300 speed, we pay for 250!
customer_reviews.author: shannon charland

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi Range, remember no phone jack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great modem and WiFi router. The range on the WiFi is much better than my last WiFi router. It does not have a dedicated phone jack so you will need to ensure you have a phone solution such as a VoIP solution to plug into one of the wired connections. The modem also has lots of room for growth in network speed to Gigabit when when you are ready to upgrade your network.
customer_reviews.author: Will Cline

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality-Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem was/is driving me crazy. Intermittent issues that I thought were attributed to my internet service provider. After two appointments with their techs (Cox Cable) the modem was swapped out..solving the lost signal/ roboot off and on problem. A lotta headache and frustration getting to this point. Although depicted as an Amazon choice, I would NOT recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The item arrived quickly and in perfect condition. My connection to the Internet is a ...
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived quickly and in perfect condition. My connection to the Internet is a million times better than it was before with my old router/modem. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Garelik

customer_reviews.title: Must buy to ditch the rental fees
customer_reviews.text: Bought this all in one modem/router after trying to connect a separate modem and router. Wish I would have bought this from the very start. Connecting took a few minutes but my xfinity app was able to find, connect, and register my new modem. 5g and 2g is available which makes connecting all devices quick and easy. Highly recommend this device and breaking away from the rental fees associated with internet accounts.
customer_reviews.author: Juice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace a rented one from comcast. It was easy to set up (had help from comcast) and works well. It seems to load pages faster and no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for 6 months and then stopped working. Contacted Motorola about replacing the modem, they cold they can not replace it until i verify power adapter is dead, i explained them power is coming on but it is not working. They told me they can not do a replacement without verifying that. Now I have to find a adapter which works with it, and i need to purchase it and then verify it. In the meantime I have not internet, they have the worst customer service, so rude, tried explaining but would not listen. What a garbage company!
customer_reviews.author: Noname User

customer_reviews.title: Unstable internet from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: Since installing this modem we started having connection issues. No one could help including Comcast reps, and Motorola support neither. Finally we suspected the modem was the issue, got a new one. No connectivity issues since then, it’s been 3 months. Sorry for all the hours I spent troubleshooting the internet when the modem was just broken.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a techie and dread setting up anything to do with computers. But I had no choice since my last wifi router modem was finally acting up and in need of a replacement. So glad I ordered this one as I can definitely see faster speeds while browsing the net and uploads/downloads. And best part, just took one read through the instructions provided and it was so easy to install and set up.......and after all that, it worked! Appreciate the fast delivery and good packaging to keep the product safe from damage during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Kevo

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router was really easy to install, and it is working much better than the "gateway" it replaced. Maybe that one just got too old after five years? i was having some computer malware problems and called the Motorola tech support people to ask a question. I knew the device wasn't "at fault", but hoped I could gain some insight if they would try to answer my question. The tech support guy was just crabby/cranky/defensive in response. That's the reason for the "three" on tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, fully featured
customer_reviews.text: I did a bit of research before settling in on this midrange-priced known-brand modem/router combo. The brief setup card had everything I needed to drop this in and start using it, and even names and numbers for the major cable providers to finish the activation (above and beyond!). the built-in admin/setup web page in the modem is quite comprehensive and configurable for enabling guest wifi, vpn, dmz, gaming, firewall protection and security logging... working well!
customer_reviews.author: Eduard Schwan

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am now on my second one the went down after one month of using. They will not return money. I guess I will be getting my third on. Twonyeara Warranty I should go through about 24 or these.
customer_reviews.author: Preacher psych.

customer_reviews.title: Motorola MG7700 24x8 Cable Modem Plus AC1900 Dual Band WiFi Gigabit Router
customer_reviews.text: I got this modem/router a week or so back and it is great. It has a dual band which is great so everyone is not overpowering the one server you are on. It was very easy to set up and I talked to my friend who did his research on this one and said this was the best to get. I had a really old one before and this one surpasses the old one by leaps and bounds.
customer_reviews.author: Tearched H. Scott

customer_reviews.title: They sent me someone's used router.
customer_reviews.text: I paid for a new router. I don't mind getting refurbished for a discount, but this wasn't even that. Unless the default wireless name for Motorola routers is "I'm Rick James Bitch" Not sure I can even say what the password is here. They couldn't even be bothered to preform the factory reset. Have no idea how good the router itself is, since whoever had it last, I think broke it, since it doesn't seem to work. I'll keep working on it, hopefully I can get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Alden

customer_reviews.title: Not approved by Xfinity and not enough Mbps
customer_reviews.text: Starting with COVID-19 in March , between working from home/online meetings and a teenage son logging into class meetings + gaming + phones, we've had a LOT of WiFI problems. This modem did not solve them and Xfinity said it's not approved. The 600 Mbps + 1000 Mbps maximum is not enough. A lot of the positive reviews are old so I think this is based on smaller households prior to everyone working at home. If you are on a lot of calls + gamer in the house this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joy2U

customer_reviews.title: OUT OF DATE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive product that does no better than a twenty dollar modem and router from wall mart. It is a 2.0 system and not any stronger, safer, or faster than the cheap one I had. Look for the updated one.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Internet Bliss Buy this gateway!!!
customer_reviews.text: Should have pulled the trigger on this gateway years ago. I'm stubborn and hold to the attitude "If it's not broken don't fix it". Finally Comcast stopped supporting my old router modem combo. I had no choice. I literally had this thing up and running in 10 minutes with online activation with no assistance. All I did was read the quick start sheet, worked great, blistering fast reliable connections the first time every time. No more frozen web pages, or buffering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router/Modem. Must have.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to avoid paying to rent Comcast’s router/modem. I have this product for couple of months now and still working great. The performance of this product is excited and the WiFi is working perfectly good in entire house. Double thumbs up. I have all four of us using the internet with 3 phones and two iPads, Mac book, two TVs, Alexa dot, Apple TV, Ring pro, and ring chime up running at same time and did not decrease my internet speed. It’s strong. I had to test it and I approved. I definitely would recommended to anyone about this product. Thank you Motorola. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Valerie L.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Properly
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed this modem router, I kept having an inconsistent wifi signal. There were even some devices that the internet or internet supported apps wouldn't work on despite indication that they were connected. Not to mention it took multiple attempts to actually connect, and multiple resets and calls to tech support had to be done. Strange enough, the wired connection would not work, while the wifi eventually was working. I will definitely be going through the hassle of returning this. It is not worth keeping and annoying that a brand new product doesn't function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Robust Router/WiFi Unit
customer_reviews.text: I installed this for my brother who was struggling with poor WiFi signal in his house. This has a strong, reliable signal that reaches all of his house and basement, making streaming video content to his basement TV setup flawless. Setup might be a little advanced for inexperienced users, but it's working beautifully now. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: MG 7700  Unbelievable Mistake
customer_reviews.text: Followed the installation menu, ended up spending 2 hours with my internet provider, Xfinity, found out the CM MAC Code (needed by installation) of the modem has been activated by another active user. Meaning either this is a refurbished/return unit to Motorola, or the unit comes with a mistakenly duplicated label during production. After having paid the full price for a brand-new unit, either cause is unacceptable. Definitely a return.
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.. don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have really fast internet and the cable modem I had before did a great job. I just upgraded my internet speed so I bought this one and it's terrible. The signal constantly goes out, it slows down my cameras, and the signal doesn't reach my other rooms. I wish I could return this junk. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Toxik

customer_reviews.title: Router component failure in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this combo modem/Router as an update 9/8/2019. In the midst of this pandemic after calling my internet provider 6 times and visits from their techs....who weren't allowed to enter my home due to local pandemic parameter restrictions I had no "internet" for weeks and relying on my cell phone was intermittent. Mobile banking was a hit or miss or mail in proposition. Finally my son arrived to troubleshoot and discover the router component had failed. Had to hook up my old Netgear Router to get wifi. What a total waste of money. I felt like I did the right research to chose Motorola but never again. Don't know what to do now with a half operational Motorola combo.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good strong signal and simply works.
customer_reviews.text: I switched to xfinity and started with the Surfboard modem/router but the signal didn't reach my Ring doorbell only 20 feet away. Granted, it's outside and through a door but still.... I sent it back and got this one. Simply, it works. From ground floor to the 3rd floor attic and out the door to the Ring doorbell and to our back porch. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Curley

customer_reviews.title: Not a huge fan of this product
customer_reviews.text: This product supports the speeds I need and the wifi range is good. The problem I have with it is I cannot get it to work correctly with my xbox while using a wired connection no matter what I try.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Esay as 123
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest fastest best move I ever made with internet. This modem is much faster than Comcast modem, went from 159 to 216, installed on 6 minutes, but Comcast operator took 15 minutes to send old back, still not sure she did it correctly, buy it it's worth the savings
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Calliari

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Motorola, xfinity limits your device.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure who this is for considering the advertised speeds are gigabit but xfinity limits you to 600. If you have a gigabit plan with this router and xfinity I was told they will literally Send out software that is basically a digital governor to limit your speed to 400mbps. So basically just rent the stupid xfinity router because if you purchase your own, they’ll just limit the speed anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from my previous comcast modem
customer_reviews.text: Definitely better than my previous comcast modem. Fast internet and reliable. The 5G is very nice because it doesn't get interfered with my bluetooth and microwave. Using the regular 2.4ghz network is more likely to get interefered by other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent wireless connection
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router due ratings and its eligibility to be used with Cox. Thus far the router has proven to be anything but a 4 star product that was a replacement to a much older Motorola modem/router. I am going to work with Cox and the Tech support again today then this is being returned. -Without warning the router will drop all connections and restart -Cameras, streaming speakers, Alexa devices will not stay connected. Computers reconnect with ease -Wireless range is ok. 5G range is very short
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Increased my range
customer_reviews.text: Comcast tried to tell me that the reason the internet was spotty in the upper floor of my house was that my modem was in the basement. The internet was working, but smart devices on the upper floor kept losing connection a few times a week. I knew that the real reason is that the modem they had me renting from them for $11 a month was inferior to other alternatives. Never had a dropped coneection since, and saving $11 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Holland

customer_reviews.title: UNRELIABLE WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Despite my decades of tech skills, I could not figure out why the Motorola MG7700 WiFi signal from a brand new modem/router kept disappearing and then reappearing minutes later. Reinstalled by years old TP-Link CR1900 which flawlessly controls 58 WiFi devices 24/7/365 (see photo)
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Truth about internet and modems/routers
customer_reviews.text: Like many modem/routers, they over-hype themselves, however it is definitely one of the better options for the price. Internet in the US is capped and signals are shared between residents nearest to each hub as opposed to individual “internet’s” the companies say they sell you. That being said, this modem/router does the best job it can do for the price. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: Much faster then my previous netgear router and the WiFi signal is much stronger. I am very happy with it was easy to setup and worked as advertised. I pay for a 200 mbps connection and used to get 125 mbps the new Motorola router runs 230-240 mbps. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great quality. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for four months now. It was easy to install. We had an Xfinity modem/router which we were renting. It was an easy switch out and install. We have a 3-level 2400 sq ft home and we get a great signal throughout. I’d recommend this product with no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: YogicBiker

customer_reviews.title: One day of super fast connection
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a breeze! Up and running in no time! Ran great... for ONE DAY.. then constant crashing, no signal, couldn't connect to internet. Ran all the troubleshooting solutions.. nothing. I dont have time to sit on the phone with Tech wait 45 mins for someone to even pick up so they can tell me to do everything I already did all again. Disappointed.. i bought this to save money from the xfinity rental and all it has done is give me a bigger headache.. now to try and get my money back for this hunk of junk.. hahaha yea that should be fun. Hooked xfinity modem back up.. i may be paying them but at least it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Z
